content:
かなしむべき〔悲しむ可き〕
〈形〉Mournful, lamentable, grievous (event) ; deplorable (state of things)

content.content: 彼の死は悲しむべし
His death is to be lamented.
彼の死は国家のために悲しむべし
He is a loss to his country.
悲しむべきことが起こった
A mournful event has happened.
ロシアの国状は悲しむべし
The state of Russia is to be deplored―Russia is in a bad way.

かなじゃくし〔金杓子〕
〈名〉A metal ladle

〈代名副詞〉There

content.content: はるか彼方に
far away
あちらこちらに
here and there

content.content: 金槌で卓子を叩く
to strike on the table with a hammer
金槌で釘を打つ
to drive a nail (with a hammer)
金槌の頭
a hammer-head
金槌の柄
the handle of a hammer

〈形〉Stone-deaf; as deaf as a post

content.content: 彼は金火箸のようにやせている
He is as thin as lath.

1. An iron bar; an iron rod

content.content: これは鬼に金棒だ
That is the very thing for me―That is just the thing for me―That's the card―That's the ticket.
金棒を引く
to gad about

content: 2. ［運動器械］A horizontal bar

2. (=つまらぬことを大仰にふれ歩く人)a gossip-monger; a scandal-monger; a gadabout

content:
かなめ〔要〕
〈名〉
1. (=扇の要)the pivot, the rivet (of a folding fan)
2. (=要点)a chief point; a main point; a vital point

content.content: ここが肝心要なところだ
This is the vital point―The whole matter turns upon this point―hinges upon this point―pivots upon this point.

かなめいし〔要石〕
〈名〉The keystone (of an arch)

かなめもち〔要冬青〕
〈名〉The Chinese hawthorn

content:
かなもの〔金物〕
〈名〉Hardware; ironmongery

content.content: 金物屋
a hardware shop―an ironmonger

content:
かならず〔必ず〕
〈副〉
1. (=きっと)certainly; ever; always; invariably; inevitably; infallibly; without fail:(打消に伴えば)never:(動詞に訳せば)to be sure to, be certain to, be bound to, never fail to (do something); to make it a rule to (do something); to make a point of (doing something)

content.content: 彼は必ず成功する
He will certainly succeed―He is sure to succeed―He is certain to succeed―He is bound to succeed―He will not fail to succeed.
必ず金を返す
I will certainly pay you―I will not fail to pay you―I will pay you without fail.
この十の教えを必ず守れ
Ever keep these precepts ten.
彼は日曜には必ずやって来る
He will always come of a Sunday.
結果は必ずこうだ
Such is invariably the result―This is the invariable result.
必ず来給え
Be sure to come!―Don't fail to come!
必ず参ります
I will certainly come―I will be sure to come―I will not fail to come―I will come without fail.
彼は必ず目的を遂げる
He is sure to accomplish his purpose―He never fails to accomplish his purpose―He never fails of his purpose.
忍耐すれば必ず忍耐しただけのことがある
Perseverance is sure of its reward―Perseverance never fails of its reward.
彼は必ず年首に来る
He makes a point of calling on me on New Year's Day.
彼は毎日必ず散歩する
He makes it a rule to take a walk every day―He makes a point of taking a walk every day―He makes a conscience of taking a walk every day.
必ず必ず忘れるな
Be sure not to forget!―Never, never forget!

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: (何々すれば)必ず(何々する)
can not... without―never... without―never... but..
二人は逢えば必ずけんかだ
They can not meet without quarrelling―They never meet without quarrelling―They never meet but they quarrel―They never meet that they do not quarrel.
僕は君に会うと必ずあの時のことを思い出す
I never see you without thinking of that day.
彼は英語を話せば必ず誤りがある
He can not speak English without making mistakes.
彼は口を開けば必ずぶちこわしを言う
He never opens his mouth without putting his foot in it.
煙があれば必ず火がある
“There is no smoke without fire.”
楽があれば必ず苦がある
“No pleasure without pain.”
悦びがあれば必ず悲しみがある
“No joy without alloy.”
生ある者は必ず滅する
“Life is subject to decay.”

content: 2. (=必然)needs; necessarily; of necessity; perforce

content.content: 必ずそうだ
It must needs be so―It must of necessity be so.

content:
かならずしも〔必ずしも〕
〈副〉(Not) always; (not) necessarily

content.content: 必ずしもそうとは限らぬ
It is not necessarily so.
曇天必ずしも雨ならず
A cloudy sky is not always a sign of rain.
富者必ずしも幸福ならず
The rich are not always happy.
勝敗は必ずしも数の多少によるものにあらず
Success in battle does not always depend on numbers.
人は学問があるからといって必ずしも良い教師になれるとは限らぬ
Because a man is a good scholar, it does not necessarily follow that he will make a good teacher―A good scholar does not always make a good teacher.
金色必ずしも黄金ならず
“All is not gold that glitters.”
烏だからとて必ずしも黒いとは限らぬ
Crows are not always black.

content:
かなり〔可なり〕
〈副〉Pretty; fairly; tolerably; passably:(=の) fair; tolerable; passable; decent; respectable

content.content: この作文はかなり好くできている
The composition is pretty well written.
この写真はかなり好くとれている
The photo is fairly taken.
彼はかなり英語を話す
He speaks English pretty well―fairly well―tolerably well.
かなりの学者だ
He is a pretty good scholar―a tolerable scholar―a passable scholar.
教授法はかなりうまい
He is a pretty good teacher―a tolerable teacher―a passable teacher.
聴衆の中にはかなり外人も見えた
There was a fair sprinkling of foreigners in the audience.
かなりの美人だ
She is a woman of passable beauty.
彼はかなりに暮らしている
He makes a decent living―cracks a tidy crust.
かなりな家に住んでいる
He lives in a decent house―a respectable house.
これならかなりの成功だ
This is a fair success―a tolerable success.

かなりや〔金糸雀<カナリヤ>〕
〈名〉The canary; the canary-bird

かなりや〔金糸雀<カナリヤ>〕
〈名〉The canary; the canary-bird

かなわ〔金輪〕
〈名〉A metal ring

content:
かなわせる〔叶わせる〕
〈他動〉To grant, answer, hear (a prayer)

content.content: なにとぞなにとぞかなわせ給え
God grant that it may be so!

content:
かなん〔火難〕
〈名〉Fire

content.content: 火難に逢う
(人なら)to be burnt out―(家なら)―be burnt down
火難除け
a charm against fire

content:
かに〔蟹〕
〈名〉The crab

content.content: 蟹の横ばい
A crab crawls sideways.
蟹は泡を吹く
A crab foams at the mouth.
蟹は甲羅に似せて穴を掘る
The crab makes a hole suited to its shell―(に相当するは)―“Cut your coat according to your cloth.”
月夜の蟹は肉が無い
Crabs caught on a moonlight night are lean.
蟹にはハサミがある
A crab is armed with claws.
蟹のハサミ
a crab's claws
蟹がハサミではさむ
A crab nips with its claws.
蟹にはさまれる
to be nipped by a crab

かにく〔果肉〕
〈名〉The flesh, the pulp (of a fruit)

content:
かにゅう〔加入〕
〈名〉Entrance; admission; accession:(=する) to enter (a society); to join (an association); to accede; to (a party)

content.content: 会に加入する
to enter a society―join an association
組合に加入する
to join a guild
同盟に加入する
to join a union
政党に加入する
to join a party―accede to a party
競争に加入する
to enter for a race
電話に加入する
to subscribe for a telephone
電話加入者
a telephone subscriber
加入申込
application for admission
加入金
entrance-fee

content:
かね〔金〕
〈名〉
1. (=金属)a metal

content.content: これは何金か
What metal is this?

content: 2. (=金銭)money

content.content: 彼は金がある
He has much money―He is rich.
金がどっさりある
He has plenty of money―lots of money―heaps of money―no end of money.
金がうなるほどある
He has a mint of money.
金がありあまっている
He has enough money and to spare.
金が無い
I have no money―I am out of cash.
金が足りない
There is not enough money―I am short of money.
金の持合わせがあるか
Have you any money with you?
金の持合わせが無い
I have no money about me.
この金は自分のものではない(預かりものだ)
This money is not my own.
自分の金は無い
I have no money of my own.
金が無いから行くのを見合わした
I have given up the idea of going for want of money.
金を取る
to get money
働いて金を取る
to work for money―earn money―turn an honest penny
彼は汗水流して金を取る
He toils and moils for money.
汗水流して取った金だ
It is hardly earned money.
彼は金取り主義だ
He goes in for money.
不正な事をして金を取る
to obtain money by unlawful means
不正な金
money obtained by fraudulent means―ill-gotten money
これはどうした金だ
How did you come by this money?
これは不正な金ではない
I came by the money honestly.
金を儲ける
to make money
彼はどんどん金を儲ける
He is making money hand over hand―He is coining money.
不正な商売をして金を儲ける
to make money by cheating
彼は金儲けに熱心だ
He is bent on making money.
金を使う
to spend money
彼はどんどん金を使う
He spends his money royally.
湯水のように金を使う
He spends money like water.
チビチビ金を使う
He fritters away his money.
生きた金を使う
He makes the most of his money.
金使いが荒い
He is wasteful of money―extravagant.
金使いが締まっている
He is frugal of his money―saving of his money.
彼は着物に金を使う、着物に金をかける
He spends much money on clothes.
酒やタバコに金を使う
He spends his money in wine and tobacco.
彼は使いきれないほど金がある
He has more money than he can spend.
金が懐でうなっている
Money is burning a hole in his pocket.
金を浪費する
to waste money
金を濫費する
to squander money―make ducks and drakes of one's money
戦争は金がかかる
War costs money.
この普請はだいぶ金がかかったろう
The building must have cost (you) much money.
金は一文もかかりません
It will not cost a farthing.
金をためる、金を貯蓄する
to save money―lay by money―set by money―put by money―hoard money―amass money
彼は金ため主義だ
He is a money-grubber.
金を積む
to deposit a sum of money
銀行に金を預ける
to deposit money in bank
金は銀行に預けてある
The money is in bank.
金はあなたにお預けしておけば銀行に預けたも同然です
The money is safe in your hands.
金を銀行から引出す
to draw money from the bank
金が要る
I want money―I am in want of money―(米国では)―I need money―I stand in need of money.
この金がぜひ無ければならぬ
I need the money badly.
金を出す
to give money
金を出せ
Hand over your money―(俗語で言えば)―Fork out your money.
金が出る(から心配するな)
Money in forthcoming.
金が入る
Money comes in.
金がどんどん入る
Money flows in―Money pours in.
金を調達する(算段する、才覚する)
to raise money―raise the dust―raise the wind
屋敷を抵当にして調達した金だ
I raised the money on my estate.
金で買う
to buy anything with money
僕は外套が欲しいけれども金が無い
I want an overcoat, but I have no money to buy one with.
金で買われない物もある
Money can not buy all things.
幸福は金で買われない
Happiness is not to be bought with money.
金で売る
to sell anything for money
金で節を売る者がある
Some people sell their honour for money.
金を借りる
to borrow money
必要に迫って借りた金だ
I borrowed money under the pressure of necessity.
僕に用と言うのは金でも借りたいのか
What can you want with me, unless you want to borrow money of me?
金を貸す
to lend one money
利息を取って金を貸す
to lend money at interest
彼を困らせるのは金を貸せと言うのだ
The way to perplex him is to ask him for a loan of money.
金を返す
to repay the money―pay one the money
この金の返済はご都合でよろしい
You may repay the money at your own convenience―You may take your own time for payment.
金をいつ返してくれるか
When will you pay me (the money)?
金を返さなければ訴えます
If you will not pay me, I will bring an action against you.
彼は金まわりが好いと見える
He seems to be well off for money―flush of money.
僕は金まわりが悪い
I am badly off for money―scant of money.
君は金まわりはどうか
How are you off for money?
彼は金が自由になる
He has money at his command.
金に不自由は無い
He has no lack of money.
金を粗末にする
to be careless of one's money
金を粗末にするな
Be careful of your money!
金を改めて受け取ったのか
Did you count the money when you received it?
この仕事は金になる
There is money in it.
この品は金になる
This article will fetch much money.
働くと金になる
Work will bring you money―You can earn money.
金にさえなれば彼は何でもする
He will do anything for the sake of money.
金が遊んでいる
The money is lying idle.
遊んでいる金
idle money―money to spare
金を遊ばしておくのは無益だ
It is unadvisable to have your money lying idle.
彼は金に困っている
He is pressed for money―hard up (for money).
僕は金に縁が無い
Money does not stay in my hands.
彼は金離れが好い
He is free with his money―generous with his money.
金を強請{ゆす}る
to extort money from one
金をしぼる
to squeeze money out of one―wring money out of one―screw money out of one
金に目がくらむ
to be blinded by money
君のような貴公子が金の有難味を知るものか
How can you, a rich man's son, know the value of money?
彼の手を経る金は少々の金ではない
Large sums of money pass through his hands.
日切りの金
money due by a fixed date
そんな金はどぶへ打っちゃつたも同然だ
The money is as good as thrown away―It is a sheer waste of money.
金を山に積んでもこんな品は無い
Such an article is not to be had for love or money.
ありそうで無いものは金
People will seem to have more money than they do have.
金で口どめする
to give one hush-money―bribe one into secrecy
金は身の仇
Money brings one evil.
金は天下のまわり物
“Money is a thing that comes and goes,”
先立つものは金
Money is the first consideration.
金が金を産む
Money breeds money.
浮世のことは金次第
“Money makes the mare to go”.
地獄の沙汰も金次第
“Money opens all doors.”
当節は金の世の中だ
Money is everything nowadays.
金の切れ目が縁の切れ目だ
The end of money is the end of love―“When poverty comes in at the door, love flies out at the window.”

content:
〈特例〉
1. A sum

content.content: これだけ金があれば当分間に合う
This sum will do for the present.
金を要るだけ調達しよう
I will make up the required sum.
まとまった金
a round sum―a lump sum

content: 2. Gold

content.content: 人間万事金の世の中
“Gold rules the world.”
この雨はまるで金が降ったようなものだ
The rain is a golden shower.
金の生る木
a mine of gold

content: 3. Cash

content.content: 僕は金がある、金が無い
I am in cash―out of cash.

content: 4. Funds

content.content: 僕は金がある、金が無い
I am in funds―out of funds.
金が無いために事業を中止した
The project was abandoned for want of funds.

content: 5. Means

content.content: 洋行したいが金が無い
I wish to go abroad, but I want the means to do so.
金が出ないから洋行を断念した
I have given up the idea of going abroad, for I can not find the means.

content: 6. Wealth

content.content: 金をためる
to amass wealth―accumulate wealth
僕は金は要らぬ
I have no desire for wealth.
金も名誉も要らぬ
I do not care for wealth or fame.
金さえあればばかでも旦那
“A man of wealth is dubbed a man of worth.”
辛抱する木にゃ金が生る
“Wealth flows from industry.”
世人は金儲けにあくせくする
People are eager for wealth.
金の威光は恐しいものだ
Such is the power of wealth.

content: 7. Riches

content.content: 金に翼あり(金が飛ぶ)
“Riches have wings.”
彼は金儲けに執心だ
His heart is set on riches.
世人は金儲けにあくせくする
People are eager to get rich.
彼は金をうんと持っている
He is very rich.
金が残る
to grow rich
お前は当り前にさえしていれば金が残るばかりだ
If you were to conduct yourself like other men, you could not help growing rich.

content: 8. A fortune

content.content: 大金を儲ける
to make a fortune
彼は米を買い占めて金を儲けたのだ
He has made his fortune by cornering rice.
金をためる
to amass a fortune

content: 9. Gain

content.content: 金にさえなれば彼は何でもする
He will do anything for the sake of gain.
金に転ぶのが当世人情だ
It is the fashion now to follow gain.

content: 10. Expense

content.content: 旅行は金がかかる
Travelling is expensive.
だいぶ金がかかる
The expenses are heavy.
金にあかして建てた家だ
The house was built regardless of expense.
彼女は金にあかさず奇羅を飾る
She gets herself up regardless (of expense).
彼は金使いが荒い
He is prodigal of his expenses―extravagant.
金使いが締まっている
He is frugal of his expenses―saving of his money.

content: 11. Cost

content.content: 大枚の金をかけて建てた家だ
The house was built at a great cost.
いくら金がかかっても子どもを洋行させる
I will send my boy abroad, whatever it may cost―cost what it may.

content: 12. Price

content.content: いくら金をだしても買う
I will buy it at any price.
いくら金を貰っても売らぬ
I will not sell it at any price.
真正の愛は金で買われぬ
True love is above price.
血の出るような金
the price of one's life-blood
すぐに金になる仕事がしたい
I want some work that can be turned to immediate account.
もっと金になる仕事がある
I can turn my time to better account.
金になる仕事
lucrative business
金の儲かる地位
a lucrative post
金を出す
to put one's hand in one's pocket
金を出せ
Down with the dust!
彼は金をどっさり出した
He came down handsomely.
彼は時々金を借りに来る
He often comes to me for pecuniary help.
金で動く人
a venal man―a mercenary man
金で動く新聞
the mercenary press
盗人に金の番
to set a wolf to watch the sheep
金の番人だ、金の持ち腐りだ
He is “a dog in the manger.”
金は親子も他人
“Business is business.”

content:
かね〔鐘〕
〈名〉A bell

content.content: 鐘をつく
to ring the bell―toll the bell
鐘を鳴らす
to ring the bell―sound the bell
鐘が鳴る
The bell rings―The bell tolls―The bell peals out.
もう鐘が鳴ったか
Has the bell rung yet?
もう鐘が鳴ったのか
Has the bell rung already?
鐘は今鳴ったばかりだ
The bell has only just rung.
あれ鐘が鳴る
There goes the bell!
鐘の音
the sound of a bell
鐘の音が陰にこもって響く
The sound of the bell dies on the night-air.
明けの鐘
the morning bell
鐘や太鼓で捜す
to search with hue and cry

content:
かね〔鉄漿〕
〈名〉The tooth-dye

content.content: かねをつける
to dye the teeth black

かねいれ〔金入れ〕
〈名〉A purse

content:
かねかし〔金貸し〕
〈名〉A money-lender; a usurer

content.content: 金貸しをする
to lend out money at interest―practise usury

content:
かねがね〔予々〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: かねて〔予て〕

かねぐら〔金倉〕
〈名〉
1. A treasury
2. (=金主)a capitalist; a financial supporter; a rich patron

かねざし〔金差〕
〈名〉The (ordinary) foot measure

かねじゃく〔金尺〕
〈名〉The (ordinary) foot measure

content:
かねずくで〔金ずくで〕
〈副〉By means of money

content.content: 金ずくで納得させたのだ
He made her comply by the power of money.
金ずくで買われない物もある
All things are not to be bought with money.
この品は金ずくでは買えぬ
This article is not to be had for love or money.
金ずくで世話をしたのでない
I did not care for him for the sake of money.
金ずくではとても彼にかなわない
I am no match for him in the matter of money.

content:
かねたいこ〔鐘太鼓〕
〈名〉Hue and cry

content.content: 鐘太鼓で迷子をさがした
They searched for the lost child with hue and cry.
そんな人は当節は鐘太鼓でさがしても無い
Such men are not to be met with―much to seek―nowadays.

content:
かねためしゅぎ〔金溜め主義〕
〈名〉Money-grubbing

content.content: あの男は金ため主義だ

content:
かまう〔構う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=意に介す)to care about, concern oneself about, trouble oneself about (some matter)

content.content: 彼は身なりにかまわぬ
He does not care about dress―He is careless about his dress―indifferent about his dress.
親父は食物にはかまわないが酒はやかましい
My father is indifferent about food, but particular about wine.
彼は家事にはいっこうかまわぬ
He does not care about―does not concern himself about―does not trouble himself about―does not trouble his head about―household matters.
人は何を言おうとかまわん
I don't care what people say―Let people talk!
今度成功しようと失敗しようとかまわん
I do not care―It does not matter―whether I succeed or fail this time.
どちらが勝とうと負けようとかまわぬ
I don't care―It doesn't matter―It makes no matter―It is no matter―which side may win or lose.
自分のことはかまわないが子どもが心配だ
I don't care for myself, but I fear for the children.
あんな奴は死んでもかまわん
I don't care if he dies―He may die for all I care.
後はどうなろうともかまわん
It may go to the devil for all I care―for all me―for me.
そんなことはどうでもかまわん
I don't care (about that)―That doesn't matter―That is no matter―That is of no consequence.
かまうものか
I don't care―Never mind!

content: 2. (=厭う)to mind

content.content: 少しくらい損をしてもかまわぬ
I do not mind a little loss―I don't care if I lose a little.
十円の損になりますがかまいませんか
Don't you mind losing 10 yen?
骨の折れるのはかまいません

金はいくらかかってもかまいません

寒いのはかまわないが暑いのは閉口だ
I don't mind the cold, but I can't stand the heat.
彼が去ろうとかまわぬ
I don't mind his leaving―have no objection to his leaving―I don't care if he leaves―He may leave.
君は行ってもかまわん
You may go―I don't mind your going―I don't care if you go―I have no objection to your going.
僕が来てもかまいませんか
Don't you mind my coming?
何であろうとかまうな
Never mind what it is!
為すべきことを為せば後はどうなろうとかまうな
Do your duty, and never mind the consequences.
彼女を貰え、年が少し違うくらいはかまわんさ
Marry her! Never mind the difference in age!
君はかまわんでもはたが迷惑だ
You may not mind it, but the others do.
おかまいなさるな
Never mind!
どうぞおかまいなく―お先に
Please go on without minding me!―After you, sir!
こわれたと、かまわん、また買えばよい
Broken? Never mind!―No matter!―I can buy another.

content: 3. (=重んずる)to have a regard for (anything)

content.content: 彼は人の感情などにはさらにかまわぬ(がみがみ言う)
He has no regard for others' feelings.
彼らは法律などにはかまっていない
They have no regard for the laws―defy the laws.

content: 4. (=顧みる)to have regard to (anything)

content.content: 彼は体裁などはかまわぬ
He has no regard to appearance.
僕は輿論にかまわずに思うところを行った

I disregarded the public opinion, and went my own way―I defied the public opinion, and went my own way―I set the public opinion at defiance, and went my own way―I went my own way in defiance of public opinion.
彼は医者の注意にかまわず相変らず飲んでいる
He keeps on drinking in defiance of his doctor's warning.
入費にかまわず建てた家だ
The house was built regardless of expense.
彼女は金にかまわず奇羅を飾る
She gets herself up regardless (of expense).
後先にかまわず尽すべきことを尽せ
Do your duty, irrespective of the consequences.
彼女は誰彼をかまわず剣突を喰わせる
She will scold people without respect of persons.

content: 5. (=留意する)to give heed to (advice)

content.content: 彼は人に何を言われてもさらにかまわぬ
He gives no heed to advice or warning.
彼は危険などにはかまわぬ
He is heedless of dangers.
身の安危にはかまわぬ
He is reckless of his own safety.

content: 6. (=取合う)to take notice of (a person)

content.content: その家へ行くことは行ったけれども誰もかまってくれる者がなかった
I did go to the house, but nobody took any notice of me.
僕は彼をかまいつけぬ
I take no notice of him.
叫んで助けを求めたけれども誰もかまってくれる者が無かった
I cried for help, but nobody took any notice of my cries.

content: 7. (=相手にする)to have concern with, have to do with (one)

content.content: あの男は誰もかまい手が無い
No one will have any concern with―have anything to do with―have anything to say to―that man.
お前は言うことを聴かないともうかまわないぞ
If you will not obey me, I will have nothing more to do with you―I have done with you for the future―I wash my hands of you.

content: 8. (=干渉する)to interfere in, meddle in (a matter)

content.content: 人のことにかまうな
Do not meddle in others' affairs!
君がかまうとかえってぶちこわしてしまう
If you interfere in the matter, you will make a mess of it―Your interference will do more harm than good.

content: 9. (=からかう)to tease, molest (a person)

content.content: お前は子どもにかまって泣かせる
You tease the children and make them cry.
彼は知らない犬にかまって喰いつかれた
He teased a strange dog, and got bitten.
女にかまうな
Do not molest the girl!―Let her be!―Let her alone!―Leave her alone!―Leave her in peace!
そんなものにかまうな(打っちゃっておけ)
Let it alone!―Leave it alone!
不都合の無いものにかまうな(藪蛇を出すな)
Let well alone!

content: 10. (=世話する)to care for, look after (a person)

content.content: あの子は(孤児で)誰もかまってくれ手が無い
She has no one to care for her.
お母さんは忙しくて子どもにかまっていられません
Mamma is too busy to be looking after her children.

content: 11. (=もてなす)to entertain, be attentive to (a guest)

content.content: どうもおかまい申しませんで失礼致しました
You will pardon my taking so little trouble to entertain you―You will excuse my want of attention.
どうぞもうおかまい下さるな
Please do not trouble yourself about me!―Do not stand on ceremony with me!
私のためにわざわざおかまい下さるな
Do not put yourself out of the way on my account!
そうおかまい下さると上がりにくくなります
It you put yourself out of the way on my account, you will drive me away from your house.

content:
12. (=追放する)to banish (a criminal)
13. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 何紙でもかまわん
Any paper will do.
いくらでもかまわん
Any sum will do.
どうぞおかまいなくお勉強を
Please go on with your reading!
僕は思うことをかまわず言う
I speak my mind freely.
彼らはあたりかまわず見せつける
They indulge in demonstrative behaviour in the presence of people.
ばかにかまうと日が暮れる
I will not waste words on a fool.

content:
かまえ〔構え〕
〈名〉
1. (=構造、体裁)construction; structure; style; appearance

content.content: 家の構えはなかなか立派だ
The house makes a fine appearance.
大した構えだ
It is a grand house.
家の構えは医院向きだ
The style of the house suits it for a doctor's office.
門構えの家だ
The house has a gate in front of it.
玄関構えの家だ
The house has a porch to it.

content: 2. (=身構え)a posture; an attitude

content.content: さあ来いと構えをした
I put myself in a posture of defence―threw myself into a posture of defence―assumed a defensive attitude―placed myself on my guard―stood on guard.

content: 3. ［号令］Ready!

かまえる〔構える〕
〈他動〉
1. (=造営する)to construct, build oneself, reside in (a castle, etc.)

content.content: 邸宅を構える
to build oneself a residence
城を構える
to build oneself a castle―reside in a castle
門戸を構える
to reside in a mansion
妾宅を構える
to keep a separate establishment
一戸を構える
to keep a house
弟は別に一戸を構えています
My brother keeps a separate house―lives in his own house.
彼はまだ一戸を構える資力が無い
He has not yet the means to keep house.

content: 2. (=身構えする)to put oneself in a posture; to throw oneself into a posture; to assume an attitude; to stand ready

content.content: さあ来いと構えた
I put myself in a posture of defence―threw myself into a posture of defence―assumed a defensive attitude―put myself on my guard―stood on guard.
厳然と構える
to present a solemn front
大胆に構える
to present a bold front―show a bold front
傲然と構える
to present a haughty front
どっしりと構える
to assume an immovable attitude
大様に構える
to assume a magnanimous air
道徳家然と構える
to assume a virtuous air
呑気に構える
to take things easy
彼は落第しても呑気に構えている
He takes his failure quite easy.
鐘が鳴っても悠々と構えている
The bell may ring, but he takes things leisurely.
何事があっても好いように構えている
I stand ready for anything that may happen.
彼は何事があろうと平気に構えている
He stands coolly prepared for whatever may happen―He takes things coolly.

content: 3. (=偽る)to feign; to pretend

content.content: 病気を構える
to feign illness―pretend to be ill
銃を構える
to come to the ready

content.content: 蛇が鎌首を上げる

かまける
〈他動〉To be concerned with (anything); to be absorbed in (anything)

content:
がましい
〈接尾詞〉To look like (something)

content.content: こういうと言わけがましいが
It may look like an excuse to say so, but...
差出がましいようだが
It may look too forward of me to say so, but...
意見がましいことを申してすみません
I am sorry to say something that looks like remonstrance.
議論がましいから止そう
I will not say things which look argumentative.
こういうと理窟がましくなる
It will look like logic-chopping.
こうすると押付けがましい
It looks like compulsion.
そんな事を言うと嫉妬がましいからお止し
If you say such things, it will look as if you were jealous.
指図がましいことを申すようですが、十円もお出しになってはどうですか
It is not for me to dictate to you, but what do you say to giving ten yen?
恨みがましい文句を並べる
to multiply reproachful expressions
皆晴れがましく着飾っている
They are all dressed out in their best.
そうしてはあまり晴れがましい
It would be too public.

かます〔鰤〕
〈名〉The pike; the luce

〈名〉

〈名〉
1. A furnace; an oven; a kitchen-range

content.content: かまどを賑わす

民のかまどが賑わう
The people prosper.

content: 2. (=世帯)housekeeping

content.content: かまどを立てる
to keep a house―set up housekeeping
かまどを分ける
to keep a separate house―live separately

content:
かまびすしい〔喧しい〕

content.content: 世間がかまびすしい
The world is noisy.
この問題については輿論がかまびすしかった
The question awakened a clamorous public controversy―The public raised an outcry on the question.

content:

content.content: 蒲鉾形{なり}の
semi-cylindrical

content:
がまん〔我慢〕
〈名〉
1. Endurance; patience; perseverance; toleration; sufferance:(=する) to endure, bear, stand (pain); to tolerate, suffer (one's insolence); to support, sustain (fatigue); to be patient of (control); to put up with, make shift with (poor fare); to persevere; to hold out; to stand out; to bear up (bravely)

content.content: 日本人は子どもの時から我慢ということを教える
Japanese are taught from a child to bear pain without crying.
(痛くとも)泣かずに我慢しろ
“Grin and bear it!”
この暑さでとても我慢ができぬ
I can't stand the heat―The heat is unendurable―insupportable―unbearable―not to be borne―past bearing―past endurance.
たいがいのことは我慢するが冷笑ばかりは我慢ができぬ
I can stand anything in reason but being sneered at.
あの男の生意気は我慢ができぬ
I can not tolerate his impertinence―His impertinence is intolerable―insufferable.
何もご馳走は無いが我慢してくれ給え
You must put up with poor fare.
この待遇で我慢する気ならいつでもおいでなさい
If you will put up with these terms,―make shift with these terms,―you may come at any time.
もう我慢ができぬ
I can not hold out―stand out―any longer.
もう五分我慢すれば勝つ
Hold out five minutes longer, and the day is ours.
しかたがないことは我慢しなけりゃならぬ
“What can't be cured must be endured.”
しかたがないから我慢しよう
I will make the best of a bad bargain.
いやでも我慢しろ
“If you don't like it, you may lump it.”

content: 2. (=我慢して何かせずにいる我慢は)self-restraint; self-denial; continence; forbearance:(=する) to restrain oneself; to contain oneself; to deny oneself (the comforts of life); to forbear (doing something); to abstain from (wine); to refrain from (saying); to repress (one's anger); to suppress (a laugh)

content.content: 彼は我慢して飲みたい酒を飲まずにいる
He restrains his thirst for liquor―abstains from wine.
我慢して食う物も食わずにいる
He denies himself the comforts of life.
笑いたいのを我慢した
I suppressed a laugh.
とうとう我慢しきれなくなって吹き出した
I could not contain myself, and burst out laughing.
腹が立つのを我慢した
I repressed my anger.
腹が立って我慢ができなかった
I could not contain my anger.
言いたいことを我慢して言わずにおった
I refrained from saying what I wanted to say.
我慢しきれなくなって泣いた
I could not forbear crying―could not help crying―could not refrain from tears.

がまんづよい〔我慢強い〕
〈形〉Enduring; stoical; heroic

to season a dish with pepper
談話にこっけいを加味する

彼は学者気質で豪傑風を加味している

紙には書く紙もあり印刷用の紙もあり包み紙もある

紙を製す
to manufacture paper―make paper
紙をすく

紙に包む

紙をはる

壁に紙がはってある
The wall is papered.
紙をたたむ
to fold paper
紙を拡げる
to unfold paper
紙に書く
to write on paper
本の紙を折る
to double over a leaf―dog's-ear a book
人情の薄きこと紙の如し

1. (=上部)the upper part; the head; the top:(=の) upper; higher; first; old:(=に) above; up

content.content: 食卓の上座にすわる
to sit at the head of the table
人の上に立つ
to stand above others―“play first fiddle”
滝は橋より上(河上)だ

河上

上王侯より下万民に至るまで

上半期

上の句

old times―days of yore

content: 2. (=上の人)the Emperor; the government; one's master; one's superiors; authority

content.content: 上のご沙汰によって
by order of the government
上を犯す
to defy authority
上に見習う下
“As is the king, so are the people.”
上は下を慈しみ下は上を敬うべし
Let people love their inferiors and honour their superiors.
上にへつらう者に限って下に横柄だ
Those who fawn upon their superiors are sure to domineer over their inferiors.

content:

1. (一神教の神)God; the Deity; the Divinity; the Supreme Being:(多神教の神)a god; a deity; a divinity; an immortal:(=の) divine

content.content: 神を信ずる
to believe in God
神に祈る
to pray to God
苦しい時の神頼み
One will pray to the gods in extremity.
神を祀る
to worship the gods
人を神に祀る
to deify a man―apotheosize a man
神を敬う
to revere the gods
神かけて誓う
to swear by the gods
神に感謝する
to thank God―give thanks to God
神に捧げる
to consecrate a church to God―dedicate a temple to God
神も仏も無いものか
Is there no God?
神は見通し
Everything lies open to the gods.
正直の頭に神宿る
God dwells in an honest heart.
捨てる神があれば助ける神がある
“The angel goes out that the archangel may come in.”
触らぬ神に祟り無し
“Keep clear of the gods.”
凡夫盛りに神祟り無し

心だに誠の

道にかないなば
And follow Truth's way,
祈らずとても
The gods shall watch o'er thy career,
神や守らん

神の恵み

神の恵みを受ける

神の加護

神の罰

福の神

貧乏の神

結ぶの神

神ならぬ身
a mortal
神ならぬ身の知る由もなし

効験神の如し

芸神の如し

筆に神あり

惚れて通う

千里も一里
A thousand miles is one to love;
逢わずに帰れば
But when I can not see my love,
また千里

この線は電気が通っている

content:
から
〈前置詞相当〉
1. (=誰から)from; of; at one's hands

content.content: 兄から手紙があった

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: この本は誰から貰ったか
Who gave you this book?
伯(叔)父から貰った
My uncle gave it me.
この本は誰から借りたか
Who lent you this book?
友人から借りた
A friend lent it me.
その話を誰から聞いたか
Who told you the news?
本人から聞いた
I have it at first hand.
君から始め給え
You begin.

content: 2. (=どこから)from:(in の位置からなら)out of:(on の位置からなら)off

content.content: 君はどこから来たか
Where did you come from?
うちから来た
I came from home.
彼は戸の蔭から出て来た
He came not from behind the door.
卓子の下からはい出した
He crept out from under the table.
海外から
from over the sea
遠方から
from afar
御殿場から見た富士の景
a view of Mt. Fuji as seen from Gotenba
彼は家の中から出て来た
He came out of the house―He emerged from the house.
箱の中から品物を取り出した
I took the articles out of the box.
茶碗が食卓の上からころげ落ちた
A cup rolled off the table.
手帳から紙を一枚裂き取って手紙を書いた
I tore a leaf out of my note-book, and wrote a note.［注意］「から落ちる」には種々の場合がある。
彼は高いところから落ちた
He fell from a height.
屋根から落ちた
He fell off the roof.
馬から落ちた
He was thrown off a horse.
窓から落ちた
He fell out of a window.
鳥の子が巣から落ちておった
A young bird had fallen out of the nest.
人がこの崖から落ちた
A man fell over this precipice.
子どもが梯子段から落ちた
A child fell down the stairs.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 朝日が窓からさし込んでいた
The morning sun was shining in through the window.
ここから富士山が見える
We have a view of Mt. Fuji here.
太陽は東から出て西に入る
The sun rises in the east and sets in the west.
日本艦隊は五千メートルのところから砲台を砲撃した
The Japanese squadron bombarded the forts at a distance of 5,000 metres.

content: 3. (=入口、出口から)at:(特別の入口、出口から)by

content.content: 玄関から入る
to enter at the front door
彼は表門から入って裏門から抜けたに違いない
He must have come in at the front door and gone out at the back entrance.
誰か鍵穴からのぞいている
Somebody is peeping at the keyhole―peeping through the keyhole.
右の耳から入って左の耳から出てしまう
Come in at one ear, and go out at the other.
カニは口から泡を吹く
A crab foams at the mouth.
光線は窓から入る
Light comes in at the window―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The window admits the light.
泥棒はこの窓から入ったに違いない(特別の入口)
The burglar seems to have entered by this window.
子どもらが窓からのぞき込む
The children look in at the window.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 窓から外をのぞいた
I looked out of the window.

content: 4. (=いつから)from:(未来は)after:(から今までは)since (前置詞、接続詞)

content.content: 稽古は八時から十二時まである
School lasts from 8 to 12.
百姓は朝から晩まで働く
The peasant works from morning till night―from dawn till dusk.
僕は三時から自由の身になる
I shall be free after three.
一月一日から値上げになる
The price will be raised on and after the 1st of January.
彼が死んでから三年になる
It is three years since he died.
彼を子どもの時から知っている
I have known him since he was a child―(慣用語法は)―I have known him from a child.［注意］「何時から始まる」を“begin from”と訳すべからず。
稽古は八時から始まる
School begin at eight.
試験は十日から始まる
The examination begins on the 10th.
第一学期は四月から始まる
The First Term begins in April.
二人の交際は学校時代から始まっている
Their intercourse began in―dates from―their school-days.

content: 5. (=根源から)from

content.content: 生徒は全国から集まっている
The students come from―hail from―all parts of the country.
彼は兵卒から昇って大将になった
He rose from the ranks to be a general.
人種問題から起こった事件だ
The trouble arises from racial prejudice.
虚報は上海から出る
Canards proceed from Shanghai.
海から海産物を取る
Marine products are obtained from the Sea.
多くの日本語は仏教から出ている
Many Japanese expressions are derived from Buddhism―Many Japanese expressions may be traced to Buddhism.
彼は米国から来たてだ
He is just from America.［注意］「何から始める」は“begin with”と訳す。
仏独どちらから始めようか
Which shall I begin with, French or German?
この本のうちどれから読もうか
Which of these books shall I begin with?

content: 6. (=原因、理由から)from; of; because of; on account of; owing to; due to; in consequence of:(接続詞は)because; for; as; since; now that; seeing that

content.content: 病気だから学校を休もう
As I am ill, I will not go to school―I am ill, so I will not go to school―I will not go to school, for I am ill.
病気だから学校を休んだ
I absented myself from school because I was ill―because of illness―on account of illness.
彼は金があるから何でもできる
As he is rich, he can do anything―He is rich, so he can do anything―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His wealth enables him to do anything.
君がそう言うから僕は信ずる
Since you say so, I believe it.
彼が死んだからもうこわい者は無い
Now that he is dead, we have no one to fear.
彼は外国人だから大目に見てやる
I will make allowances, seeing that he is a foreigner.
雨が降ったから外出しなかった
Owing to the rain, I kept indoors―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The rain kept me indoors.
彼は勉強したから成功した
He succeeded in consequence of his diligence―He succeeded owing to his diligence―His success is due to his diligence.
彼の病気はあまり飲むからだ
He is ill, because he drinks too much―His illness comes of drinking too much.
そんな目に逢うのは人の言うことを聴かないからだ
That comes of neglecting my advice.
彼は若いから働ける
He can work, because he is young―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His youth enables him to work.
彼は年を取っているから働けない
He can not work, because he is old―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His old age disables him from working―prevents him from working―prevents his working.
病気だから来られなかった
As I was ill, I could not come―My illness prevented my coming.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: それだから勉強するのだ
That is why I work so hard.
早く起きたから一番汽車に間に合った
I rose so early that I was in time for the first train―I rose so early as to be in time for the first train.
僕は貧乏だからそんなぜいたくはできない
I am so poor that I can not afford such extravagance―too poor to afford such extravagance.
彼女はまだ年がいかないからお嫁に行けない
She is too young to marry.
君は金持ちだから馬車くらいはかかえられる
You are so rich that you can keep a carriage―You are rich enough to keep a carriage.
彼は賢い人だからそんなことのわからないはずは無い
He is so wise that he can not but see that―He is too wise not to see that.
この柱があるから家が倒れない
This pillar keeps the house from falling.
刑罰がこわいから罪を犯さない者がある
Fear of punishment keep some people from crime―deter some people from crime.

content: 7. (=動機から)out of (kindness); from (motives of kindness); through (envy)

僕は親切心からこう言うのだ(こう言うのも老婆心)
I say this out of kindness―from motives of kindness.
彼らがそんなことを言うのは嫉妬からだ
They say such things out of envy―through envy.

からばかだ

から不景気だ

content: 3. (=人格)character

柄に無いことをする

content:
からだ〔身体〕
〈名〉
1. The body:(強弱の身体)a constitution; a frame:(大小の身体)a physique; a frame:(医者から見た身体)the system:(四肢五体)limbs:(ずう体)a carcase

content.content: 君は好いからだだ
You have a good constitution.
からだが丈夫だ
You have a strong constitution―a robust frame―You are sound of limb.
彼は非常にからだが丈夫だ
He has an iron constitution.
母はからだが弱い
My mother has a weak constitution―a feeble frame.
か弱いからだを持ちながら
with a delicate constitution―with a fragile frame
不健康なからだでは活動ができない
With a sickly constitution, one can not take an active part in life.
君は立派なからだだ
You have a fine physique―a splendid physique.
彼はからだが大きい
He is large of limb.
大きなからだをもてあましている
He does not know what to do with his unwieldy body―his gigantic frame―his huge carcase.
からだばかり大きくてから子どもです
He has a huge carcase, but the manners of a baby.
麦飯は僕のからだに合わない
Barley-rice does not agree with my constitution―agree with me.
洋服をからだに合わせる
to fit a coat to the body
この洋服はからだに合わない
This coat does not fit me―It is a bad fit.
毒がからだに入り込む
Poison enters into the system.
からだの毒が出る
The system works out the virus.
からだを休める
to rest one's limbs―rest oneself
たまにはからだを休めるがよい
You ought to rest yourself once in a while.
からだ中あざだらけ
I am black and blue all over ［the body］.
アイヌはからだ中毛だらけだ
The Ainos are covered with hair all over.

content: 2. (=からだの工合、健康)health

content.content: おからだを大事になさい
You must take good care of your health―be careful of your health―be careful of yourself.
(病後)からだを大事にしている
I am coddling myself.
からだの工合が好い
I am in good health―I enjoy good health―I am in the enjoyment of good health.
からだの工合が悪い
I am in bad health―in ill health―out of health―ill―(米国では)―sick.
からだが丈夫になる
to gain in health
からだが弱る
to decline in health
運動はからだの薬だ
Exercise is good for the health―beneficial to health.
夜ふかしはからだの毒だ
Late hours are bad for the health―injurious to health.
酒を飲み過ぎるとからだにさわる
Too much wine is injurious to health―detrimental to health.
一日二時間の運動はからだに必要だ
Two hours a day's exercise is necessary to health.
からだを痛める
to impair one's health
からだをこわす
to break down one's health―break down one's constitution―shatter one's constitution―undermine the constitution―make oneself ill
あまり酒を飲むとからだをこわす
Wine will undermine the constitution.
君は飲み過ぎるからからだをこわすのだ
You make yourself ill by drinking too much―You drink yourself ill.
あまり勉強してからだをこわしては困る
You must not make yourself ill by working too hard―You must not work yourself ill.
彼はからだを(すっかり)こわして台湾から帰って来た
He has returned from Formosa in broken health―with a shattered constitution.
どうしてからだを悪くしたか
How did you make yourself ill?―(米国では)―make yourself sick?
元のからだになりました
I am restored to health.
からだは何より大切だ
Health is above everything else.

content:
3. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 自分のからだでない
I am not my own master.
やっと自分のからだになった
At last, I am my own master―my own man.
楽なからだになった
I am now at leisure.
忙しいからだだ
I am busy―I have no leisure.
からだにちょっとの暇も無い
I have not a minute that I can call my own.
からだを遊ばせておくのはよくない
It is not good to be idle.
よくからだが続くね
I wonder how you can stand the strain.
そうはからだが続かない
I can not stand such strain.
あのように働いてあのように烈しく遊んでからだが続くまい
He is burning the candle at both ends.
からだを粉にして働く
to fag oneself to death
からだ中痛む
I am sore from head to foot.
からだ中あざだらけ
I am black and blue all over.
あの老人はからだの自由が利かぬ
That old man is a cripple.
どうせ国家に捧げたからだだ
I have offered myself to my country―I have placed myself at the disposal of the State―My life is dedicated to my country.
からだは襤褸{つづれ}、心は錦
Rags without, brocade within.
からだだけ来て貰えば結構です
I will marry her without a wardrobe―(は日本、西洋は)―I will marry her without a fortune.
五尺のからだ入れどころ無し
There is not a nook or corner in the world to hide me.

content:
かり〔借り〕
〈名〉A loan; a debt; liabilities; what one owes

content.content: 君は借りがあるか
Do you owe anything―Are you in debt?
借りがある
I owe money―I am in debt―I am behindhand with the world.
いくら借りがあるか
What do you owe?―What is the extent of your liabilities?
一万円借りがある
I owe 10,000 yen―I am indebted in the sum of 10,000 yen―I am liable for 10,000 yen.
僕は君に借りがある
I owe you something―I owe you a debt―I am in your debt.
僕は君にいくら借りがあるかね
What do I owe you?―In what sum am I indebted to you?
君に十円借りがある
I owe you 10 yen―I am indebted to you in the sum of 10 yen―Ten yen is owing to you―Ten yen is due to you.
彼に古い借りがある
I owe him a debt of long standing.
借りをこしらえる
to run into debt
あの金はまだ借りになっている
The money still remains unpaid.
方々に借りがたまった
I have run up debts.
あの店にだいぶ借りがたまった
I have run up a long bill at that shop.
借りが増えるばかりだ
My debts go on increasing.
借りがかさむ
The debts swell.
借りを返す
to pay a debt―improve one's face
借りを返すのは当たり前
One ought to pay what one owes.
借りを返さなければならぬ
I must pay my debts―get square with my creditors―improve my face.
借りを綺麗に返す
to pay off one's debts―clear off one's debts―clear oneself from debts―free oneself from debts
この金があれば借りが綺麗に返せる
This sum will free me from debts―clear me from debts.
僕は借りが無い
I am free from debts―out of debt―on a par with the world.
借りは一文も無い
I owe no man a cent.

The company are at cards.

to win at cards―lose at cards

to shuffle cards

to deal cards

a game at cards

to have a game of cards

to give a card party
歌カルタ
poem-cards
カルタ一組
a pack of cards

dry grass―hay

content.content: 彼も人、我れも人

content:

content.content: 家令づら
a perpetual smile
家令づらをして我々を案内した
He ushered us in with a perpetual smile on his face.

content:
かれい〔家例〕

content.content: こうするのが家例になっております
It is the custom with us to do so.

content:

〈形〉Splendid; gorgeous

content.content: 華麗なる宮殿
a gorgeous palace
その華麗人目をくらます
Its splendour dazzles the eye.

〈名〉The sole; the plaice; the flounder

content:
かれき〔枯木〕
〈名〉A dead tree

content.content: 枯木に花を咲かせる
to make a dead tree blossom
あの人にそんなことができたら枯木に花が咲く
You might as well expect a dead tree to blossom as expect him to do such a thing.
枯木も山の賑い
Anything is better than nothing.

かれくさ〔枯草〕
〈名〉
1. Dry grass
2. (=乾草)hay

かれごえ〔嗄声〕
〈名〉A hoarse voice; a husky voice

content:
かれこれ〔彼是〕
〈代名詞〉This and that→『

content.content: かれこれいう〔彼是言う〕
かれこれするうちに〔彼是する内に〕

content:
』
〈副〉About; nearly

content.content: もうかれこれ十二時だろう
It must be nearly twelve.
僕がここへ来てからかれこれ十年になる
It is about ten years―some ten years―since I have been here.
集まった者がかれこれ三十人もあったかね
Some thirty people came together.
かれこれ一時間も待ったかね
I have been waiting an hour or so.

content:
かれこれいう〔彼是言う〕
〈自動〉(反対するの意味なら)to make objections; to raise objections:(苦情なら)to make complaints; to make difficulties:(非難なら)to question; to call in question:(世評なら)to talk:(干渉なら)to meddle:(指図なら)to dictate

content.content: 彼の親類がかれこれ言って縁談に承知しない
His relations make objections to the match.
役人がかれこれむつかしいことを言うだろう
The official will make difficulties.
いったん買った物にかれこれ言うのは大人気無い
It is not manly to make complaints about an article after you have bought it.
人にかれこれ言われるのがいやだ
I do not like to have my conduct called in question.
そんなことをすると世間でかれこれ言う
If you do such a thing, people will talk.
かれこれ言うのはご免だ(おせっかいはご免)
No meddling in my affairs, please!
僕がかれこれ指図がましいことを言うところじゃないが、百円も出したらどうかね
It is for me to dictate to you, but won't a hundred yen do?

content:
かれこれするうちに〔彼是する内に〕
〈副〉(In the) meantime; meanwhile

content.content: かれこれするうちに戦争もすんだ
Meanwhile, the war had come to an end.

content:
かれこれや〔彼是屋〕
〈名〉One who lives by his wits

content.content: あれはずいぶん彼是屋だ
He lives by his wits.

かれつ〔苛烈〕
〈形〉Caustic; acrimonious; pungent; poignant

〈名〉A bleak field

〈名〉A withered leaf

content:

〈名〉→『

content.content: かれは〔枯葉〕

かれら〔彼等〕
〈代名詞〉They:(=の) their:(=に) them:(=を) them

content:
かれる〔枯れる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=草木が死ぬ)to die; to wither

content.content: この木は枯れた
The tree is dead.
根を絶てば枝葉は枯れる
If the root is cut off, the branches and leaves will wither.
この植物は霜に逢うと枯れる
Frost will kill this plant.
一将功成って万骨枯る
“The many must labour for the one.”
やせても枯れても元が元
“It is not in gold to be oxidized.”

content: 2. (=円熟する)to mature; to mellow; to season

content.content: 彼の腕が枯れて来た
His talents have matured.
この酒は枯れている
The wine is mellow.
材木が枯れている
The timber is well seasoned.
この刀は枯れている
It is a seasoned blade.

content:
かれる〔嗄れる〕
〈自動〉(=声が嗄れる)To be hoarse; to be husky

content.content: 声が嗄れた
I am hoarse―My voice is husky.
風邪を引いて声が嗄れた
A cold has made me hoarse.

content:
かれる〔涸れる〕
〈自動〉To dry up

content.content: 井戸が涸れた
The well is dried up.
信用の本源が涸れた
The fountain of trust is poisoned.
彼の思想はもう涸れた
The fountain of his inspiration is dried up―His idea do not flow any longer―He has written himself out.

content:
かれん〔可憐〕
〈形〉
1. (=可哀そうな)pitiful; poor
2. (=可愛らしい)lovely; pretty

content.content: 可憐な少女
a pretty girl

かろう〔家老〕
〈名〉A chief retainer (of a daimyo)

content:
かろう〔過労〕
〈名〉Excessive labour; overwork; strain:(=する) to work too hard; to overwork oneself; to strain one's powers; to overtax one's powers

content.content: 彼は過労のために身体をこわす
He makes himself ill by overworking himself―He works himself ill.
過労のために倒れる青年は少なくなった
Few young men now die of overwork―work themselves to death.
過労がこたえてきた
The strain is telling on me.

content:
かろうじて〔辛うじて〕
〈副〉Barely; narrowly; just; with difficulty; with much ado

content.content: 彼は辛うじてのがれた
He had a narrow escape.
辛うじて死を免れた
He narrowly escaped death―He barely escaped death―He was snatched from the jaws of death.
彼は辛うじて目的を遂げた
He barely accomplished his purpose.
辛うじて成功した
He succeeded with difficulty―with much ado.
彼は辛うじて生計を立てている
He makes a bare living.
辛うじてその日を送っている
He rubs along somehow―scratches along anyhow.
辛うじて試験を通過した
He struggled through his examination―scraped through his examination.
爪立てになって辛うじて届く窓だ
You can just reach the window on tiptoe.
来会者は辛うじて百名に達した
The attendants barely reached a hundred.

content:
かろがろしい〔軽々しい〕
〈形〉
1. (=軽薄な)light, frivolous, undignified (behaviour, etc.)
2. (=軽率な)hasty, rash, heedless, thoughtless, careless, imprudent, indiscreet (action, etc.)

content.content: そんな軽々しいことをしてはいかん
You must not take such an imprudent step.

content:
かろがろしく〔軽々しく〕
〈副〉Lightly; hastily; rashly; heedlessly; thoughtlessly; carelessly; imprudently; indiscreetly; heels over head, head over heels

content.content: これは軽々しく黙過すべきことではない
The matter must not be lightly passed over.
これは軽々しく断ずべきことではない
The matter admits of no hasty decision.
軽々しく判断するなかれ
Beware of hasty decision.
新聞の記事は軽々しく信じられぬ
Newspaper accounts are not to be believed in haste.
彼は軽々しく請合わない
He will not make rash promises.
一生の連合いを選ぶには軽々しくは決められない
One can not be too careful in choosing one's partner for life.
一身上に関する事を軽々しく決めてはならぬ
You must be prudent―use prudence―in deciding on what concerns your welfare.
彼は軽々しく口を開かぬ
He is discreet.
軽々しく口を出す
He is indiscreet.
軽々しく大任を引受けてしまったのだ
I had taken a trust on myself heels over head―head over heels.
彼は人の言うことを軽々しく信ずる、軽々しく信ぜぬ
He is credulous―incredulous.
軽々しく兵禍を放つべからず
One must think twice before letting loose the dogs of war.

かろがろと〔軽々と〕
〈副〉Lightly; easily; without any effort

かろく〔家禄〕
〈名〉A hereditary fief

content:
かろし〔軽し〕
〈叙述形容詞〉(To be) light

content.content: 命は軽し
I hold my life light―hold my life as nothing―set my life at nothing.
義は泰山よりも重く身は鴻毛よりも軽し
I hold my life but light, as compared with my cause.
我が物と思えば軽し笠の雪
“A voluntary burden is no burden.”

かろしめ〔軽しめ〕
〈名〉Contempt:(=る) to despise (a man)

content:
かろんずる〔軽んずる〕
〈他動〉To make light of (one's illness); to set light by (a matter); to make little of (the task); to think little of (the difficulty); to set (one's authority) at naught; to set (one's life) at nothing; to hold (one's life) light; to hold (men) cheap; to slight (a man); to neglect (a matter); to despise (death, etc.)

content.content: 彼は病気をこれしきのことと軽んじているうちに手後れになった
He made light of his illness, till it was too late.
生命を軽んずる
to set one's life at nothing―hold one's life light
義を重んじ身を軽んず
I hold my life but light, as compared with my cause.
輿論を軽んじて思うところを行った
I set public opinion at naught, and went my own way.
人を軽んずるのは悪い癖だ
It is a bad habit to slight people―to hold men cheap.
彼は事業の困難なことを軽んじている
He makes little of―thinks little of―the difficulty of the work.
君は事を軽んじたのが悪かった
You ought not to have made light of the matter―neglected the matter.
これは決して軽んずべきことではない
This is by no means a negligible matter.
彼は軽んずべき人でない
He is not a negligible quantity.
一寸光陰軽んずべからず
Improve every moment!

〈名〉(大なるものは)a river:(小なるものは)a rivulet; a brook:(大小にかかわらず)a stream

content.content: 河が流れる
A river flows.
河がうねって流れる
A river winds―A river meanders.
隅田川は東京市中を流れて東京湾に入る
The (river) Sumida flows through the City of Tokyo, and empties into the Bay of Tokyo.
河が溢れる
A river overflows.
河が出水する
A river rises.
河の水が退く
A river goes down.
河が岸を洗う
A river washes its shores.
河を越す、河を渡る
to cross a river―(泳いでなら)―swim across a river―swim over a river
河を渉る、河を徒渉る
to wade across a stream―ford a stream
河の源
the source of a river―the head of a river
河を溯ってその水源を探る
to trace a river to its source
この河はその源を湖水に発する
The river flows from a lake―The river rises from a lake―The river takes its rise in a lake.
河の土手
the bank of a river
河のほとり
the banks of a river
河の上流
the upper courses of a river―the upper reaches of a river
河の下流
the lower courses of a river―the lower reaches of a river
河上
up stream
河下
down stream
河を上る
to go up a river―go upstream
河を下る
to go down a river―go downstream
河のこちら側に
on this side of the river
河の向こう側に
on the other side of the river
河向こうに
across the river
川股
the fork of a river
川中
the middle of a river
河底
a river-bed―the channel of a river
河の支流
a tributary (stream)
河口
the mouth of a river―an estuary
河童の河流れ、河立ちは河で果てる
“Good swimmers are oftenest drowned.”
彼は河で死んだ
He was drowned in a river.
あの人に河で助けられたことがある
He once rescued me from drowning.
川船
a river-boat
川蒸気
a river-steamer
川風
a river breeze
川魚
a fresh-water fish

content:

川中

a river-bed―the channel of a river
河の支流
a tributary (stream)
河口

河童の河流れ、河立ちは河で果てる

a river-boat
川蒸気

content:
かわ〔側〕
〈名〉
1. A side

content.content: その家はどちら側か
On which side of the street is the house?
こちら側か向こう側か
Is it on this side or on the other side?
河のこちら側に、向こう側に
on this side of the river―on the other side of the river
この河はこちら側は浅いが向こう側は深い
The river is shallow on this side, but deep on the other side.
両側
either side (both sides と言うべからず).
河が両側に溢れた
The river overflowed on either side.
その家は北側か
Is the house on the north side?
右側だ
It is on the right-hand side.
内側が赤くて外側は青い
It is red on the inside and green on the outside.

content: 2. (=列)a row

content.content: 二側に並ぶ
to stand in two rows

content:
かわ〔皮〕
〈名〉The skin; the integument:(牛馬の皮)a hide:(虎や熊の皮)a skin:(なめし皮)leather:(毛皮)a fur; a pelt:(木の皮)bark:(果物の皮)rind:(蜜柑の皮)peel:(パンなどの皮)crust:(葱などの皮)a coat:(竹などの皮)a sheath:(芋などをむいた皮)parings

content.content: 虎死して皮を残す
A tiger leaves a skin behind him.
虎の皮
a tiger-skin
豹の皮
a leopard-skin
熊の皮
a bear-skin
馬の皮
a horse-hide

a cow-hide

a sheep-skin

a pig-skin

a rabbit-skin

a shark-skin

orange-peel

the rind of a water-melon
靴の皮
shoe-leather
皮のついた芋
potatoes in the skin
皮を鞣{なめ}す
to tan hides―dress skins
皮をむく
to peel off the skin―excoriate the skin―(魚のなら)―skin a fish―(木のなら)―bark a tree―(馬のなら)―flay a horse―(蜜柑のなら)―peel an orange―(リンゴのなら)―pare an apple―(一般の果物のなら)―rind a fruit―(唇のなら)―excoriate the lips
リンゴの(むいた)皮
an apple-paring
面{つら}の皮をむいてやった
I put him to shame―put him to the blush.
皮がむける
The skin peels off.
顔の皮がむける
The face peels.
化の皮がむける
to show one's true colours―show the cloven hoof―betray oneself
皮が張る
A crust forms―A coat forms―on the surface.
本は革綴じ
The book is bound in leather.
美人は皮一重
“Beauty is but skin-deep.”
人間の皮をかぶった化物だ
He is a monster in human shape.
骨と皮ばかり
He is all skin and bones―a bag of hones―reduced to a skeleton.
腹の皮をよじる
to split one's sides with laughter
面の皮が厚い
He is brazen―brazen-faced―impudent―saucy―as bold as brass―(米国にては)―cheeky―(英国が米国人を評して)―Jonathan has cheek―(米国人が英国人を評して)―Cockney assurance.

content:
がわ〔側〕
〈接尾詞〉Side

content.content: 左側を歩行すべし
Walk on the left-hand side―Keep to the left.
河は両側に溢れた
The river overflowed on either side.
君は資本家側か
Do you take sides with the capitalists?―take part with the capitalists?
労働者側の意見
the views of the labouring interest

かわあい〔川合い〕
〈名〉A confluence

content:
かわいい〔可愛い〕
〈形〉
1. Dear; darling

content.content: 君は可愛い人だよ
I love you―You are dear to me.
おお可愛い
Dear man!―Dear girl!―My darling!
ばかな子ほど可愛い
The greater the dunce, the dearer he is to his parents.
かたわな子ほど可愛い
A deformed child is all the dearer to its parents.
自分の子が可愛いなら助けておやり
Help the poor children, for the love of your little ones!
この子は可愛いくて叱れない
I can not scold the child for very love.
可愛い子は棒で育てろ
“Spare the rod, and spoil the child.”
可愛い子には旅をさせろ
If you love your child, send him out into the world.
坊主が可愛いけりゃ袈裟まで可愛い
“Love me, love my dog.”

content: 2. (=可愛らしい)→『

content.content: かわいらしい〔可愛らしい〕

content:
かわいがる〔可愛がる〕
〈他動〉To love (a person); to pet (a child); to cherish (one as a brother); to hold (one) dear; to dote on (a child); to make much of, think much of (a child)

content.content: 彼は皆に可愛がられる
He is beloved of all.
正直だから皆に可愛がられる
His honesty makes him beloved of all.
この子はお婆さんに可愛がられています
The child is petted by his grandmother―a favourite with his grandmother.
彼はたいそう主人に可愛がられている
He is a favourite with his master―in favour with his master―in high favour with his master―in his master's good graces.
正直で主人に可愛がられた
His honesty made him a favourite with his master.
あの男は女に可愛がられる
He is a favourite with the ladies.
女に可愛がられる男は身が持てない
A man may be beloved to his ruin.
彼は若い細君を持ってむやみに可愛がっている
He dotes on his young wife.
老人は孫どもをむやみに可愛がる
The old man dotes on his grandchildren.
君は子どもを可愛がり過ぎる(から甘たれるのだ)
You spoil your children by making too much of them.
こういうわけで彼女は一家の人々に可愛がられるようになった
Thus the family came to hold her dear―Thus she endeared herself to the family.
わたしゃ独り者、可愛がっておくれ
Love and pity me, an orphan girl!

content:
かわいさ〔可愛いさ〕
〈名〉Dearness

content.content: 可愛いさあまって憎さ百倍
The deepest love turns into the deepest hatred.

content:
かわいそう〔可哀そう〕
〈形〉
1. (=憐むべき)poor (follow); pitiful (girl); pitiable (condition); piteous (cry); sad (story); sorry (plight)

content.content: あの子は可哀そうだ
The child is to be pitied.
可哀そうな孤児だ
She is a poor orphan.
可哀そうな話だ
It is a sad story―a pathetic story.
可哀そうに
Poor fellow!―Poor girl!―Poor creature!―Poor soul!―Poor thing!―God help him!
可哀そうに、飯も食うまい
Poor fellow! he can have tasted no food.
可哀そうに出損なって焼け死んだ者がある
Some poor fellows could not get out, and were burnt to death.
老人は可哀そうに一人息子を無くなした
The poor old man has lost his only son.
子どもが可哀そうに河で死んだ
The poor child was drowned.
あの女は可哀そうな身の上だ
She is in a pitiable condition―in a pitiful plight―in a sorry plight―in a sad predicament―in a bad way.
子どもが可哀そうな声を出して泣いた
The child raised a piteous cry.
可哀そうでたまらなかった
I was moved with pity.
可哀そうでどうしても打てなかった
I could not beat him for very pity.
子どもが可哀そうだから彼を助けてやった
I spared him out of pity for his children.
彼を可哀そうに思った
I took pity on him.
人は可哀そうに思わない
People take no pity on him―feel no pity for him.
可哀そうと思うなら助けておやり
For pity's sake, help the poor fellow!

content: 2. (=残酷)cruel

content.content: 生ま殺しにして気をもませるのは可哀そうだ
It is cruel to keep him in suspense.
君はよくそんな可哀そうなことができるね
How can you be so cruel?

かわいた〔乾いた〕
〈形〉Dry (clothes); parched (lips, etc.)

content:
かわいらしい〔可愛らしい〕
〈形〉Lovely; sweet; pretty

content.content: 可愛らしい娘だ
She is a lovely girl―a sweet girl―a pretty girl.
可愛らしい子
a lovely child
可愛らしい花
a pretty flower
可愛らしい子猫
a pretty kitten
小娘が可愛らしい声で歌う
She sings in a sweet voice.
子どもが可愛らしくおしゃべりする
The child prattles prettily.

かわうお〔河魚〕
〈名〉A fresh-water fish

content:

content.content: 川獺の皮のついた外套

content.content: かわうそ〔川獺〕

content:

content.content: 天日で乾かす
to dry anything in the sun
火で乾かす
to dry anything before the fire―dry anything over the fire

content:
かわかぜ〔河風〕
〈名〉A river-wind; a river-breeze

content.content: 河風寒く
The wind is cold upon the river;
千鳥鳴く
The sand-bird's call doth make me shiver.
吹けや河風
Blow, river-zephyr, blow!
簾を捲けや
And raise the jealous blind!
今の小唄の
For I would have thee show
主見たや
Who kills me from behind.

かわかばん〔革鞄〕
〈名〉A leather bag

かわかぶり〔皮被り〕
〈名〉Phimosis:(=の)phimosed (penis)

content:
かわかみ〔河上〕
〈名〉The upper courses of the river; the upper reaches of the river:(=に) up the river; up stream:(=の) upstream

content.content: その町は河上だ
The town is up stream.
十マイル河上だ
It is ten miles up the river.

content:
かわき〔渇き〕
〈名〉Thirst

content.content: 渇きを止める
to quench one's thirst―slake one's thirst

かわぎし〔川岸〕
〈名〉The shores of a river

content:
かわきり〔皮切り〕
〈名〉Overcoming the initial difficulty

content.content: 皮切りをする
to pave the way for anything
改革の皮切りになった
The reform paved the way for others.
彼が移民の皮切りをした
He paved the way for other emigrants.

content:
かわく〔渇く〕
〈自動〉To be thirsty

content.content: 喉が渇いた
I am thirsty―I feel thirsty.
渇ききった口
a mouth parched with thirst

content:
かわく〔乾く〕
〈自動〉To dry

content.content: 着物が乾いた
My clothes have dried―My clothes are dry.
土地が乾ききっている
The soil is parched.
乾ききった土地
parched soil―thirsty soil
墨痕未だ乾かず
The ink is not yet dry.
唇の乾かぬうちにそんなことを言っている
He says such things in the same breath.
彼女は袖の乾く間も無い
She does nothing but cry all the time.

かわぐち〔河口〕
〈名〉The mouth of a river; an estuary

かわごし〔河越し〕
〈名〉Fording:(=する) to ford a river; to wade across a stream

かわごろも〔皮衣〕
〈名〉A fur robe

content:
かわしも〔河下〕
〈名〉The lower courses of a river; the lower reaches of a river:(=に) down the river; down stream:(=の) downstream

content.content: その町は河下だ
The town is down stream.
十マイル河下だ
It is ten miles down the river.

かわじょうき〔川蒸気〕
〈名〉A river-steamer

かわじり〔川尻〕
〈名〉The lower stream

content:
かわす〔交わす〕
〈他動〉
1. To exchange

content.content: 彼と言葉を交わしたことは無い
I never exchanged words with him―bandied words with him―talked with him.
枕を交わす
to lie with―sleep with―a man or a woman
身を交わす
to dodge
ヒラリと身を交わして打ち込む太刀をはずした
I nimbly dodged the blow.

content:
かわず〔蛙〕
〈名〉The frog

content.content: 蛙が鳴く
A frog croaks.
蛙が跳ぶ
A frog jumps.
井戸の中の蛙大海を知らず
“Home-keeping youths have homely wits.”
古池や
Old garden lake!
蛙飛び込む
The frog thy depths doth seek,
水の音
And sleeping echoes wake.

content:
かわすじ〔川筋〕
〈名〉The course of a river

content.content: 川筋に沿うて進んだ
We proceeded along the stream.

かわずとび〔蛙跳び〕
〈名〉Leap-frog:(=する) to play (at) leap-frog

content:
かわせ〔為替〕
〈名〉A money order; a bill of exchange; an exchange; a bill; a draft; a cheque

content.content: 為替を振り出す、為替を組む
to draw a bill of exchange―draw a cheque
誰あてに為替を組む
to draw a cheque in favour of some one
ロンドンへ百ポンドの為替を振り出して貰いたいのです
I want you to draw a cheque on London for 100 pounds.
金百ポンド為替を以て御送付申候間御領収下され度候
I have sent you a cheque for 100 pounds, which I trust you will find correct.
為替を払う
to cash a money order―cash a cheque
為替を払って貰いたい
I want a cheque cashed.
為替振出人
the drawer
為替受取人
the payee
銀行為替
a bank-bill
銀行為替で金を送る
to remit money by bank-bill―remit money through a bank
郵便為替
a postal money order―a post office order (P. O. O.―と略す)
郵便為替で金を送る
to remit money by P. O. O.
小為替
a postal note
小為替で三十円送った
I have sent 30 yen in postal notes.
電信為替
a telegraphic money order―a telegraphic transfer―a telegraphic remittance
電信為替で金を送る
to remit money by telegraphic transfer
外国為替相場
the rate of exchange
外国為替相場表
the course of exchange

かわせ〔川瀬〕
〈名〉The shallows of a river; rapids

content:
かわせい〔革製〕
〈形〉Bound in leather

content.content: 革製の本
a leather-bound book

content:
かわせてがた〔為替手形〕
〈名〉A bill of exchange; an exchange; a bill; a draft; a cheque

content.content: 為替手形の第一券(第二券)
the first of exchange―the second of exchange

content:
かわぞい〔川添い〕
〈形〉Along the river

content.content: 川添いの地面
ground along the river

かわぞこ〔河底〕
〈名〉A river-bed; the channel of a river

content:
かわたけ〔川竹〕
〈名〉A life of shame

content.content: 川竹に身を沈める
to lead a life of shame―live in open sin

content:
かわだち〔河立ち〕
〈名〉One brought up near a river:(hence) a good swimmer

content.content: 河立ちは河で果てる
“Good swimmers are oftenest drowned.”

content:
かわつき〔皮付き〕
〈形〉Unskinned

content.content: 皮付きの芋
potatoes in the skin

content:
かわった〔変わった〕
〈形〉
1. (=異なる)different

content.content: 君は何をするにも人と変わったやり方する
You do everything in a different way.
変わった品が無いかね
Have you anything different?
いろいろ変わった品がございます
We have various articles―a variety of articles.

content: 2. (=異常な)strange; peculiar; unusual; uncommon; extraordinary; out of the common

content.content: あの人はどこか変わったところがあるか
Is there anything peculiar about him?
別に変わったところは無い
There is nothing peculiar about him.
才能も別に変わった才能じゃない
His talents are nothing out of the common.
変わったことをする人だ
He does strange things―does unusual things―does extraordinary things.
何か変わったことがあったか
Has anythings happened?
何も変わったことはありません
Nothing has happened―There has been no accident.

content: 3. (=珍しい)novel; new; strange

content.content: 何か変わったことはありませんか
Is there no news?
見るもの聞くもの皆変わっている
Everything I see or hear, is strange to me.

content:
かわづたいに〔河伝いに〕
〈副〉Along the river

content.content: 河伝いに行けば海に出る
“Follow the river, and you will find the sea.”

かわづら〔河面〕
〈名〉The surface of a river

content:
かわと〔革砥〕
〈名〉A strop

content.content: 剃刀を革砥で研ぐ
to strop a razor

content:
かわど〔皮砥〕
〈名〉A strop

content.content: 剃刀を皮砥で研ぐ
to strop a razor

かわどめ〔河止め〕
〈名〉Stoppage of passage across a river (owing to a flood)

content:
かわながれ〔河流れ〕
〈名〉Drowning

content.content: 河童の河流れ
“Good swimmers are oftenest drowned.”

かわなめし〔皮鞣し〕
〈名〉(事)tanning hides; dressing skins:(人)a tanner

かわはぎ〔皮剥ぎ〕
〈名〉The file-fish

content:
かわばた〔川端〕
〈名〉A riverside

content.content: 川端の家
a house (down) by the river
川端へ涼みに行く
We go down to the riverside to enjoy the evening cool.
何をくよくよ
Why worriest thou so,
川端柳
O willow by the brook?
水の流れを
The tide is high or low,
見て暮す
And glad or sad I look.

かわひも〔革紐〕
〈名〉A strap; a thong:(靴のは)a lace; a boot-lace:(鞭のは)a lash:(猟犬をつなぐのは)a leash

content:
かわびらき〔川開き〕
〈名〉A river f?te (in summer)

content.content: 両国の川開きはいつか
When does the river f?te at Ryogoku take place?

かわまた〔川又〕
〈名〉The fork of a river

content:
かわむこう〔河向こう〕
〈名〉The other side of a river:(=に) on the other side of the river; across the river

content.content: その家は河向こうです
The house stands across the river―on the other side of the river.
河向こうへ渡る橋がありますか
Is there a bridge to cross over to the other side of the river?―a bridge to cross the river?
河向こうの火事だ、河向こうのけんかだ
The matter does not concern me―That's no concern of mine―That's none of my business.

かわや〔厠〕
〈名〉The water-closet (W. C.―と略す); the privy; the lavatory; the necessary (house):(米国にては)the toilette:(学校、病院などにては)the latrine

かわやなぎ〔川柳〕
〈名〉The osier

content:
かわゆい〔可愛い〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: かわいい〔可愛い〕

content:
かわら〔河原〕
〈名〉A dry river-bed

content.content: 河原乞食
an actor

content:
かわら〔瓦〕
〈名〉
1. A tile

content.content: 瓦で屋根をふく
to roof a house with tiles―tile the roof
瓦屋根
a tiled roof
瓦ぶきの家
a tile-roofed house―a tiled house
瓦を焼く
to burn tiles
瓦焼き
a tile-burner
瓦窯
a tile-kiln
煉瓦
a ridge-tile
石を起こし瓦を掘って詮索する
to leave no stones unturned
瓦は磨いても玉にならぬ
You can not “make a silk purse out of a sow's ear.”
瓦となって全からんより玉となって砕けよ
Better be a broken gem than a whole brick.
瓦玉と化す
He found it brick and left it marble.

かわらけ〔土器〕
〈名〉An unglazed earthenware cup

かわらこじき〔河原乞食〕
〈名〉(A contemptuous name for) an actor

かわらひわ〔河原鶸〕
〈名〉The goldfinch

かわらぶき〔瓦葺き〕
〈形〉Tile-roofed, tiled (house)

かわらやね〔瓦屋根〕
〈名〉A tiled roof

content:
かわり〔代わり〕
〈名〉
1. (=代用物、代理人、後任者)a substitute (for something); some one to take one's place; a successor:(=に) as a substitute for (something); instead of, in place of, in lieu of, in the room of (some one or something); in behalf of, on behalf of (some one)

content.content: 僕は代わりをさがしている
I am looking out for a man to take my place.
代わりのあり次第に止める
I shall leave as soon as I find a successor.
田中さんの代わりがありましたか
Have you found any one to take Mr. Tanaka's place?
君が去るなら代わりをさがす
If you leave, I'll find another man.
僕は病気だから弟が代わりをする
I am ill, and my brother will take my place.
弟が私の代わりに教えます
My brother will teach in my place.
彼は僕を追い出して代わりに入ったのだ
He has supplanted me―superseded me.
甲の代わりに乙を使う
to use one thing instead of―in place of―in lieu of―in the room of―another
金の代わりに品物を取って下さるか
Will you take some goods in place of money?
西洋では薪炭の代わりに電気を使用している
In western countries, electricity is used for heating instead of fuel.
校長が職員一同の代わりにあいさつをした
The principal delivered an address in behalf of the staff.
甲が乙の代わりになる
One thing serves as a substitute for another―serves for another―does duty for another.
この室が事務所の代わりになる
This room will serve for the office.
この箱が食卓の代わりになる
This box will serve for a table.
代名詞が名詞の代わりをする
A pronoun does duty for a noun.
芋は穀物の代わりになる
Potatoes serve as a substitute for corn.
何か米の代わりになる食物は無いか
Is there any substitute for rice?

content: 2. (=代償)compensation:(=に) in compensation for (something):(動詞に訳して)to make up for (something); to set (one thing) against (another)

content.content: 君に損をさした代わりに儲けさして上げる
You shall make a profit in compensation for your loss.
教えるのは骨が折れる代わりに楽しみがある
The pleasure of teaching makes up for its toil.
彼は学力が無い代わりに勉強する
He makes up by diligence for his want of ability.
甲は美人だがその代わり乙は才子だ
You may set the cleverness of the one against the other's beauty.
お前を使ってやるからその代わり酒を止めろ
I will employ you on condition that you give up drinking.

content: 3. (=食物のお代わり)a second help; another helping

content.content: お代わりする
to ask for a second help
お代わりをしてもよいものか
Is it proper to ask for a second help?
お代わりを上げましょうか
Will you have another helping?
幾度もお代わりをして食った
They asked for it again and again.
酒のお代わり
Bring another bottle!

content: 〈接続詞〉But

content.content: 教えるのは骨が折れる代わりに楽しみがある
It is hard work to teach, but it has its pleasure.
彼は学力が無い代わりに勉強する
He is wanting in ability, but he works hard.
甲は美人だがその代わり乙は才子だ
The one is beautiful, but the other is clever.
お前を使ってやるからその代わり酒を止めろ
I will employ you, but you must give up drinking.
品は安い代わりに持ちが悪い
The article is cheap, but it does not wear well.
彼は遊ぶ代わりによく働く
He frequents gay quarters, but at other times he works hard.
彼は物事に熱中しやすい代わりに飽きるのも早い
He will go, heart and soul, into a scheme, but he will soon grow tired of it.
彼は味方が多い代わりに敵も多い
He has many admirers and many detractors.

content:
かわり〔変り〕
〈名〉
1. (=変化)a change

content.content: 職員に変わりは無い
There is no change in the staff.
病人は今日は別に変わりはありません
The invalid is no better nor worse today.

content: 2. (=変更)an alteration

content.content: 時間割に変わりがありますか
Are there any alterations in the time-table?
職員が変わっても授業に変わりは無い
The change in the staff does not affect the class-work.

content: 3. (=相違)a difference

content.content: 甲乙とも少しも変わりは無い
There is no difference between the two.
方法は違っても目的に変わりは無い
The means are different, but the end is the same.
しかしありがたいに変わりは無い
But I thank you all the same.
箱根は東京と変わりは無い
Hakone is the same as Tokyo―Hakone is another Tokyo.
世界中人情に変わりは無い
Human nature is the same all the world over―“Man is man everywhere.”

content: 4. (=変種)a variety

content.content: 変わり花
a fancy flower
変わり鳥
a fancy bird
変わりチョッキ
a fancy waistcoat

content: 5. (=事変)an accident

content.content: お変わりはありませんか
How are you?―Are you well?
(国から来た人に向かって)お国の方ではお変わりはありませんか
How did you leave your family?
(医者が診察して)あなたの肺にはなんの変わりもありません
Your lungs are all right―Nothing is the matter with your lungs.

content:
かわりあう〔代り合う〕
〈自動〉To relieve each other; to take turns

content.content: 兄弟が代わり合って親の看護をした
The brothers took turns in sitting up with their sick father―The brothers sat up with their sick father by turns.

content:
かわりがわり〔交り交り〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: かわるがわる〔交る交る〕

かわりきょうげん〔替り狂言〕
〈名〉A new programme of theatrical performances

かわりばえする〔代り栄えする〕
〈自動〉To change for the better

content:
かわりばんに〔交り番に〕
〈副〉Alternately; by turns; turn and turn about

content.content: かわり番に夜番をする
We keep watch by turns―We take turns in keeping watch.
兄弟がかわり番に親の看護をした
The brothers sat up with their sick father by turns―The brothers took turns in sitting up with their sick father.
かわり番に起きていましょう
Let us keep awake turn and turn about.

content:
かわりめ〔変り目〕
〈名〉A change; a turning-point

content.content: 時候の変わり目
a change of season
今は時候の変わり目だ
The season is changing.
この病気は時候の変わり目に起こる
The disease breaks out at the change of season.
潮の変わり目
the turn of the tide
今は潮の変わり目だ
The tide is on the turn.
芝居の変わり目
a change of programme
彼は変わり目ごとに芝居へ行く
He goes to the play at every change of programme.

content:
かわりもの〔変り者〕
〈名〉An eccentric person; an original; an oddity; a crank; a queer fish

content.content: あの男はずいぶん変わり者だ
He is quite a character.

content:
かわりやすい〔変り易い〕
〈形〉Changeable (mind); variable (wind); fitful (breeze); fickle (weather); inconstant (heart); unsettled (weather); mutable (world)

content.content: 天気が変わりやすい
The weather is fickle―The weather is unsettled.
変わりやすい風
a variable wind―a shifting wind―a fitful breeze
変わりやすきは男心と秋の空
Men are as fickle as autumn weather―(に相当するは)―“Woman is as fickle as April weather.”
気の変わりやすい人だ
He is a man of moods.

content:
かわる〔代る〕
〈他動〉To supply the place of, take the place of, replace, supersede, supplant, be substituted for (something); to relieve (one)

content.content: 機械が人力に代わる
Machinery takes the place of human labour―Machinery replaces human labour―Machinery supersedes human labour―Human labour gives place to machinery.
電灯がランプに代わった
The electric light has replaced―superseded―the oil-lamp.
電気が蒸気に代わる
Electricity will take the place of steam―Steam will give place to electricity.
弟が僕に代わります
My brother will take my place.
僕に代わって授業をします
He will teach in my place.
暫く代わってくれ給え
Will you take my place for a while?
代わりましょう
I will take your place―I will relieve you.
田中氏が辞職して伊藤氏が代わって校長になった
Mr. Ito became principal in place of Mr. Tanaka who had resigned―vice Mr. Tanaka who had resigned.
彼は僕を追い出して取って代わったのだ
He has supplanted me.
校長が職員一同に代わってあいさつをした
The principal delivered an address in behalf of the staff―on behalf of the staff.
僕に代わって彼に礼を言って下さい
Please thank him in my name.
あの店は代が代わった
The establishment has changed hands.

content:
かわる〔変る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=変化する)to change; to vary; to alter; to turn; to shift; to veer; to chop

content.content: 君はたいそう変わった
You have changed very much.
見違えるほど変わった
I should not know you if I met you in the streets―Your own mother would not know you.
世の中は変われば変わるものだ
The times will change―It is a changeable world―a mutable world.
風が変わる
The wind shifts―The wind veers―The wind chops about.
あの人の心は絶えず変わる
He will chop and change.
潮が変わる
The tide turns.
旗色が変わる
The tide of war turns.
旗色が変わった
The tide of war has turned―(好くなれば)―in our favour―(悪くなれば)―against us.
彼は旗色が変わると態度を一変する
He turns his coat at the first turn of the tide.
あの旅館は代が変わった
The hotel has changed hands.
空模様が変わった
A change has come over the sky.
彼は顔色が変わった
A change has come over his countenance.
九月一日から規制が変わる
The regulations will be altered on and after the 1st of September.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 食物は味が変わる
Food becomes stale―turns sour.
何か変わったことがあったら知らして下さい
If anything happens, please let me know.

content: 2. (=変形する)to change into, turn into, be turned into, be transformed into, be metamorphosed into (something else)

content.content: 水は固形体にも気体にも変わる
Water changes into ice and steam―turns into ice and vapour.
毛虫が蝶に変わる
A caterpillar is metamorphosed into a butterfly.
乞食が紳士に変わった
A beggar is transformed into a gentleman.

content: 3. (=違う)to differ; to be different; to vary; to be peculiar

content.content: これはいつものと変わっている
This is different from the usual one.
あの人は普通の人とどこか変わったところがある
There is something about him that makes him different from other men―There is something peculiar about him.
彼はどこも変わったところは無い
There is nothing peculiar about him.
手段は変わっても目的は変わらない
The means are different, but the end is the same.
箱根は東京と変わらない
Hakone is the same as Tokyo―Hakone is another Tokyo.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: ところ変われば品変わる
Each country has its own customs.
僕は寝床が変わると眠れない
I can not sleep in a strange bed.
あの男はよほど変わっている
He is eccentric―an original―an oddity―a crank―a queer fish―quite a character.

content:
かわるがわる〔交る交る〕
〈副〉By turns; turn and turn about; one after the other; alternately

content.content: かわるがわる夜番をした
We kept watch by turns―We took turns in keeping watch.
兄弟がかわるがわる親の看護をした
The brothers sat up with their sick father by turns―The brothers took turns in watching with their father.
彼は左右の足をかわるがわる揚げた
He raised one of his feet after the other.
かわるがわる起きていようじゃないか
Let us keep awake turn and turn about!

content.content: 官に就く
to take office
彼は官に就いている

官を辞す
to resign (one's office)―resign (one's post)

願によって官を免ぜらる

かん〔寛〕
〈名〉Lenity; leniency; indulgence:(=なる) lenient; indulgent

to err on the side of lenity

If man must err, it is better to err on side of lenity than to err on the side of severity.

content:
かん〔感〕
〈名〉

見て不快の感を起こす
I revolt at the sight.
今昔の感にたえず
I can not but feel how the times have changed.
万感胸に迫る
A thousand emotions throng on my heart.
感極まる
to be deeply moved―moved to the depths of one's heart
感極まって言葉無し
My heart is too full for words.
聞く者皆感極まって泣く
The listeners were all overcome―moved to tears.
彼は感極まって人を殺した
He was provoked into killing a man.
感に打たれる
to be struck
意外の感に打たれる
It strikes me as strange.

content: 2. (=感心)admiration

content.content: その妙技を見るもの感にたえず
They were lost in admiration at the wonderful performance.

〈名〉A coffin

to coffin the body

〈名〉

content.content: 款を敵に通ず

〈名〉

content:
〈前置詞相当〉

考えてみれば先生は偉いね
Now that I come to think of it, he is a great man.
そんなことを考えたばかりで死んでしまう
The very thought would kill me.
退いて考える
to pause to think―stop and consider
彼は年にしては考えが深い
He is thoughtful for his years―thoughtful beyond his years.
考えが浅い
He is thoughtless―unthinking.
何をぼんやり考えているんだ
“A penny for your thoughts!”

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼は机に向かってぼんやり考えている
He sits at his desk in a brown study.
どう考えてもウソらしい
Surely it must be false.
どう考えても合点がいかぬ
It beats me.
彼は後々のことまで考える
He takes long views―look far ahead―He is far-sighted.

content: 2. (=思想)a thought; an idea

content.content: 考えは言葉をもって言い表わす
Thoughts are expressed by means of words.
言葉は考えを伝える
Words convey ideas.
彼の考えは世間より十年進んでいる
His ideas are ten years ahead of the age.
彼は考えに富んでいる
He is rich in ideas―full of ideas.
筆は立つが考えが乏しい
He is a good writer, but poor in ideas.

content: 3. (=念)an idea; a notion

content.content: 考えが一つ胸に浮かんだ
An idea occurs to my mind.
そりゃうまい考えだ
It is a good idea―a bright idea―a happy idea.
考えを起こす
to conceive an idea
英語を組織的に教えてみようという考えを起こした
I conceived the idea that English might be taught on system.
君はどうしてそんな考えを起こしたか
What put that idea into your head?
悪口を言って人を害そうとは浅はかな考えだ
It is a foolish idea to think of injuring others by calumny.
君はずいぶん妙な考えを懐いている
You are possessed with a strange notion.

content: 4. (=熟考)consideration:(=る) to consider; to think over (a matter)

content.content: 一つ考えてみましょう
I will consider.
よく考えてお返事を致します
I must think over the matter―think the matter over―before giving my answer.
とくと考えてご覧
Think seriously of the matter―Lay it to heart―“Put that in your pipe and smoke it.”
いまいちおうお考え下さい
I hope you will think better of your resolution―reconsider your resolution.
哲学上の問題を考える時は心を虚心平気にして
Philosophical questions should be considered free from all bias.

content: 5. (=斟酌)consideration:(=る) to consider; to take (anything) into consideration; to take (anything) into account

content.content: 費用の点も考えなければならぬ
We must take the expenses into consideration.
年の若さを考えてみれば彼が失敗をしたのもしかたがない
His youth must be taken into account―considered.
道の遠くなったのを考えなかったから後れた
I left the distance out of account―left the distance out of consideration.

content: 6. (=反省)reflection:(=る) to reflect on (something)

content.content: 後先を考えて事をする
to reflect on the consequences of one's actions
少しは後先を考えてみるがよい
You ought to reflect on the consequences.
後先の考えも無くありたけ使ってしまった
I spent all the money I had without reflecting on the consequences.
考えてみると僕が悪かった
On reflection, I find was in the wrong.

content: 7. (=意見)(one's) opinion, views, way of thinking:(=る) to think

content.content: 考えを述べる
to give one's opinion―deliver an opinion―express one's views
お考えはどうですか
What is your opinion?―What do you think?
僕の考えでは今度の方が好いようだ
In my opinion,―To my thinking,―this is a change for the better.
幸福は境遇よりも考えようだ
Happiness depends not so much on circumstances as on one's way of thinking.

content: 8. (=意志)an intention; a design; a view; an idea:(=る) to intend

content.content: 僕は来年試験を受ける考えだ
I intend to take the examination next year.
僕は学者になる考えは無い
I have no intention of becoming a scholar.
僕の初めの考えは工学者になるつもりであった
My first intention was to become an engineer.
彼は洋行する考えで貯金している
He is saving money with the view of going abroad―with a view to going abroad.
彼は英語を研究する考えで上京したのだ
He has come to town with the idea of studying English.
彼は別に深い考えもあるまい
He can't have any deep design.
考えを実行する
to carry out an intention―carry a design into execution
(僕は輿論にかまわず)自分の考え通りを実行した
I set the public opinion at defiance, and went my own way.

content: 9. (=予期)expectation:(=る) to expect

content.content: 試験は考えたよりもやさしかった
The examination was easier than I had expected.
結果は考えと違う
The result is contrary to my expectations.
考えがはずれる
to be disappointed of one's expectations
僕は考えがはずれた
I have reckoned without my host.

content: 10. (=判断)judgment; conclusion

content.content: 君の考えに任せる(よろしく頼む)
I leave it to your judgment.
どうも考えがつかない
I can not come to a conclusion―arrive at my conclusion.

content: 11. (=思慮)prudence; discretion

content.content: あれは考えある若者だから失錯はあるまい
He is a prudent young man―(だからしゃべりはしまい)―a discreet young man.
年をとると考えが深くなる
Prudence will come with years―Years will bring discretion.

content: 12. (=沈思)meditation:(=る) to meditate

content.content: 彼は考えに沈んでいる
He is sunk in meditation―lost in thoughts.

content: 13. (=想像)a conception; an idea

content.content: (彼は山家育ちで)船というものはどんな物だか考えが無い
He has no idea of what a ship is like―He has no conception of what a ship is like.
見なけりゃどんなものだか考えがつかない
You can form no idea of what it is like, unless you see it for yourself.
考えたばかりでもぞっとする
I shudder at the bare idea―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The bare idea makes me shudder.

content: 14. (=趣向)a plan; an idea

content.content: 何か好い考えはないか
Can't you think of some good plan?
一つ考えがある
I have thought of a plan―An idea has occurred to me.
何とかほかに考えがあったろうに
You might have thought of some other plan.
彼は別に深い考えもあるまい
He can not have any deeply laid plans.

content: 15. (=覚悟)a plan; a resolution:(=る) to form a plan; to make a resolution

content.content: 彼は入獄中将来についていろいろかんがえた
While in prison, he formed many plans―made many resolutions―about the future.
先方の出よう次第でこちらにも考えがある
I have a plan ready if he does not demean himself properly.
要求に応じられんとおっしゃるなら私も考えがあります
If you will not comply with my demands, I will make trouble.

content:
かんがえあたる〔考え当る〕
〈自動〉To occur to one's mind; to suggest itself to one's mind

content.content: 考え当たったことがある
Something occurs to my mind.
そう言われてみると考え当たることがある
That suggests something to my mind―That reminds me of something.

content:
かんがえかた〔考え方〕
〈名〉How to solve

content.content: 問題の考え方
how to work out a sum―how to solve a problem

content:
かんがえごと〔考え事〕
〈名〉Something to think about

content.content: ちと考え事をしている
I am doing some thinking.
考え事があるから人がいるとうるさい
I wish to be left to my thoughts.

content:
かんがえこむ〔考え込む〕
〈自動〉To retire into oneself; to shrink into oneself

content.content: また黙ってしまって考え込んでいる
He has relapsed into silence, and retired within himself.
彼は机に向かってぼんやり考え込んでいる
He sits at his desk in a brown study.
何をぼんやり考え込んでいるんだ
“A penny for your thoughts!”

content:
かんがえだす〔考え出す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=思い出す)to recall; to call to mind; to recollect

content.content: その名がどうしても考え出せない
I can not, for the life of me, recollect his name.

content: 2. (=案じ出す)to think of (a plan); to think out (a plan); to devise (a plan)

content.content: 一策を考え出した
I have thought of a plan―thought out a plan.

content: 3. (=考え始める)to fall to thinking

content.content: これを見て考え出した
I fell to thinking at the sight―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The sight set me thinking.

content:
かんがえちがい〔考え違い〕
〈名〉A misapprehension; a mistake

content.content: 僕の考え違いだった
I am mistaken.
君は妙な考え違いをしている
You labour under a strange mistake.

content:
かんがえつく〔考え付く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=思い付く)to think of (a plan)

content.content: どうも名案が考えつかない
I can't think of any good plan―No good idea occurs to me.

content: 2. (=思い出す)to recall; to call to mind; to recollect

content.content: その名がどうしても考えつかない
I can not, for the life of me, recollect his name.

content:
かんがえなおす〔考え直す〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=再考する)to think better of, reconsider (one's resolution)

content.content: いまいちおうお考え直しを願う
I hope you will think better of your resolution―reconsider your resolution.
考え直してみれば僕の方が悪かった
On second thoughts, I find I was in the wrong.

content: 2. (=再三考える)to think over again

content.content: どう考え直してみても承諾する気にはなれぬ
I have thought over and over again, but I can't bring myself to consent to the proposal.

content:
かんがえぶかい〔考え深い〕
〈形〉Thoughtful; prudent; discreet

content.content: 彼は年にしては考え深い
He is thoughtful for his years―thoughtful beyond his years.
彼は考え深い若者だ
(だから過ちはあるまい)He is a prudent young man―(だからしゃべりはしまい)―a discreet young man.

content:
かんがえもの〔考え物〕
〈名〉
1. (=考究すべき問題)a matter for consideration; a question

content.content: 彼に金をやるのは考えものだ
It is a question whether we ought to give him money or not.
金持ちになるのも考えものだ
One must think twice before getting rich.

content: 2. (=謎)a puzzle; a riddle

content.content: 考え物を解く
to solve a puzzle―solve a riddle

content:
かんがえよう〔考え様〕
〈名〉One's way of thinking

content.content: 幸福は境遇よりも考えようだ
Happiness depends not so much on circumstances as on one's way of thinking.

content:
かんかく〔感覚〕
〈名〉Sensation; sense; the senses; sensibility; feeling

content.content: 物体は感覚によってこれを知る
Objects are received by sensation―presented through the senses.
彼は感覚鋭い
He has keen senses―fine senses―quick senses―He is acute―thin-skinned.
感覚が鈍い
He has dull senses―He is obtuse―thick-skinned.
感覚が無い
to be senseless―insensible
感覚を失う
to loss sensibility―be benumbed
感覚の無い
insensible―benumbed―numb
足がしびれて感覚が無い
My legs are asleep and have lost their sensibility―My legs are numb.
手が寒くて感覚が無い
My hands are benumbed with cold.
感覚の快楽
the pleasures of sense―sensuous pleasures
感覚器
the sense-organs
感覚中枢
the sensorium
感覚神経
the sensory nerve
感覚植物
a sensitive plant
感覚論
sensationalism

content:
かんかく〔観客〕
〈名〉A spectator:(集合的に言えば)the audience

content.content: この劇場は観客五千人を容れるに足る
The theatre can accommodate 5,000 spectators.
観客堂に満つ
The audience fills the house―The play draws a full house.

content:
かんかく〔間隔〕
〈名〉A space; an interval

content.content: 間隔を明ける
to leave spaces (between)
間隔を詰める
to leave no space
一間ずつ間隔をおいて木が植えてある
The trees are set at intervals of six feet―The trees are set six feet apart.
一定の間隔をおいて窓が切ってある
The windows are cut a regular intervals.

かんかく〔扞格〕
〈名〉Inconsistency; antagonism:(=する) to be inconsistent with (each other); to be antagonistic to (each other)

content.content: 彼は漢学ができる

漢学者
a Chinese scholar

〈名〉The music of wind-instruments

〈自動〉To put up a prayer; to prefer a petition
